intro: Moraea verdickii, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a member of the Iridaceae family and is native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, which bloom from late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
